tn.ref: This is the land that still remains
tn.text: You may clarify that this is the land that Israel still needs to capture. AT: "This is the land that still remains for Israel to capture" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This is the name of a place. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: which is considered property of the Canaanites
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "which the Canaanites now consider their property" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is the name of a people group. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Mearah ... Aphek ... Baal Gad ... Mount Hermon
tn.text: These are the names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a people group who lived in Geba. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
this is the name of a place (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
The land that Israel will claim is spoken of as if it were an inheritance that they will receive as a permanent possession. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
These are the names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
a place where the river is far below the land on the sides
flat land high above rivers
These are the names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: the region of the Geshurites and Maacathites
tn.text: "the land where the Geshurites and Maacathites lived"
These are the names of people groups. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Here "Moses" represents the Israelite army that Moses led. AT: "Moses and the Israelites attacked them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
These are the names of people groups. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Geshur and Maacath live among Israel
tn.text: "Geshur" and "Maacath" are either the names of the ancestors of "the Geshurites" and "the Maacathites" or are the names of the cities in which they lived. AT: "those people live among Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This refers to the period of time in which the author wrote this book.
The land that Moses assigned to the tribes of Israel is spoken of as if it were an inheritance that they received as a permanent possession. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: The offerings of Yahweh ... are their inheritance
tn.text: The writer speaks of the great honor that the Levites had by serving Yahweh as priests as if the offerings were something that they would inherit. AT: "The offerings of Yahweh ... are what they will have for their provision" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"offerings that the people were to bring to Yahweh"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "that the priests burned with fire" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
These are the names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Translate these words in the same way you did in [[:en:bible:notes:jos:13:08|13:9]].

tn.ref: Heshbon ... Dibon ... Bamoth Baal ... Beth Baalmeon ... Jahaz ... Kedemoth ... Mephaath ... Kiriathaim ... Sibmah ... Zerethshahar
tn.text: These are the names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Beth Peor ... Pisgah ... Beth Jeshimoth ... Heshbon
tn.text: These are the names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Sihon ... Evi ... Rekem ... Zur ... Hur ... Reba
tn.text: These are the names of people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: together with the leaders of Midian
tn.text: "as he had defeated the leaders of Midian"
The Jordan River was the western border of the land that the tribe of Reuben received.

tn.ref: This was the inheritance of the tribe of Reuben
tn.text: The land that Moses assigned to the tribe of Reuben is spoken of as if it were an inheritance that the tribe of Reuben received as a permanent possession. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: given to each of their clans
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that Moses gave to each of their clans" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Jazer ... Aroer ... Heshbon ... Ramath Mizpah ... Betonim ... Mahanaim ... Debir
tn.text: These are the names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Beth Haram ... Beth Nimrah ... Zaphon ... Heshbon
tn.text: These are the names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: This is the inheritance of the tribe of Gad
tn.text: The land that Moses assigned to the tribe of Gad is spoken of as if it were an inheritance that the tribe of Gad received as a permanent possession. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Moses gave an inheritance to the half tribe of Manasseh
tn.text: The land that Moses assigned to the half tribe of Manasseh is spoken of as if it were an inheritance that he gave to them as a permanent possession. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Only half of the tribe received this land because the other half received land on the other side of the Jordan River.
This can be stated in active form. AT: "Moses assigned it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
These are the names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "Moses assigned these" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is a man's name. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: This is the inheritance that Moses assigned to them
tn.text: The land that Moses assigned to the tribes of Israel on the east side of the Jordan is spoken of as if it were an inheritance that Moses gave to them as a permanent possession. AT: "This is the land that Moses assigned to them as an inheritance" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Yahweh, the God of Israel, is their inheritance
tn.text: The writer speaks of the great honor that the Levites had by serving Yahweh as priests as if Yahweh were something that they would inherit. AT: "Yahweh, the God of Israel, is what they have" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
